title: Manager.0.91.0
description: This is the schema definition for a Manager.  Examples of managers are BMCs, Enclosure Managers, Management Controllers and other subsystems assigned managability functions.
specification: This resource shall be used to represent a management subsystem for a Redfish implementation.

ManagerType.description: This property represents the type of manager that this resource represents.

enumDescriptions.ManagementController: A controller used primarily to monitor or manage the operation of a device or system
enumDescriptions.EnclosureManager: A controller which provides management functions for a chassis or group of devices or systems
enumDescriptions.BMC: A controller which provides management functions for a single computer system

ManagerType.specification: The value of this property shall describe the function of this manager.  The value EnclosureManager shall be used if this manager controls one or more services through aggregation.  The value BMC shall be used if this manager represents a traditional server management controller. The value ManagementController shall be used if none of the other enumerations apply.

ManagerForServers.specification: The value of this property shall be a reference to a resource of Type ComputerSystem that this manager is responsible for managing.
ManagerForServers.description: This property is an array of references to the systems that this manager has control over.

ManagerForChassis.specification: The value of this property shall be a reference to a resource of Type Chassis that this manager is responsible for managing.
ManagerForChassis.description: This property is an array of references to the chasis that this manager has control over.

EthernetNICs.specification: The value of this property shall contain a reference to a resource of Type Collection where the MemberType shall be EthernetNetworkInterface which are for the use of this manager.
EthernetNICs.description: This is a reference to a collection of NICs that this manager uses for network communication.  It is here that clients will find NIC configuration options and settings.

SerialInterfaces.specification: The value of this property shall contain a reference to a resource of Type Collection where the MemberType shall be SerialInterface which are for the use of this manager.
SerialInterfaces.description: This is a reference to a collection of serial interfaces that this manager uses for serial and console communication.  It is here that clients will find serial configuration options and settings.

NetworkService.specification: The value of this property shall contain a reference to a resource of Type ManagerNetworkService which represents the network services for this manager.
NetworkService.description: This is a reference to the network services and their settings that the manager controls.  It is here that clients will find network configuration options as well as network services.

Logs.specification: The value of this property shall contain a reference to a resource of Type Collection where the MemberType shall be LogService which are for the use of this manager.
Logs.description: This is a reference to a collection of Logs used by the manager.

VirtualMedia.specification: The value of this property shall contain a reference to a resource of Type Collection where the MemberType shall be VirtualMedia which are for the use of this manager.
VirtualMedia.description: This is a reference to the virtual media services for this particular manager.

self.specification: This property shall contain the href to this resource.

links.description: The links array contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.

UUID.description: The Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) for this Manager
UUID.specification: The value of this property shall contain the universal unique identifier number for the manager.

Model.description: The model information of this Manager as defined by the manufacturer
Model.specification: The value of this property shall contain the information about how the manufacturer references this manager.

SerialConsole.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Serial Console service of this manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if the Serial Console service is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol used for Serial Console purposes.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: Indicates the maximum number of Serial Console sessions, regardless of protocol, this manager is able to support.
MaxConcurrentSessions.specification: The value of this property shall contain the maximum number of concurrent Serial Console sessions supported by the implementation.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Serial Console connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.SSH: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the SSH protocol
enumDescriptions.Telnet: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the Telnet protocol
enumDescriptions.IPMI: The controller supports a Serial Console connection using the IPMI Serial-over-LAN (SOL) protocol

items.specification: The value of ConnectTypes shall be an array of the enumerations provided here.  SSH shall be included if the Secure Shell (SSH) protocol is supported.  Telnet shall be included if the Telnet protocol is supported.  IPMI shall be included if the IPMI (Serial-over-LAN) protocol is supported.

CommandShell.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Command Shell service of this manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if the Command Shell service is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol used for Command Shell purposes.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: Indicates the maximum number of Comamnd Shell sessions, regardless of protocol, this manager is able to support.
MaxConcurrentSessions.specification: The value of this property shall contain the maximum number of concurrent Command Shell sessions supported by the implementation.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Command Shell connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.SSH: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the SSH protocol
enumDescriptions.Telnet: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the Telnet protocol
enumDescriptions.IPMI: The controller supports a Command Shell connection using the IPMI Serial-over-LAN (SOL) protocol
enumDescriptions.Oem: The controller supports a Command Shell connectino using an OEM-specific protocol

ConnectTypesSupported.specification: The value of ConnectTypes shall be an array of the enumerations provided here.  SSH shall be included if the Secure Shell (SSH) protocol is supported.  Telnet shall be included if the Telnet protocol is supported.  IPMI shall be included if the IPMI (Serial-over-LAN) protocol is supported.

GraphicalConsole.description: The value of this property shall contain the information about the Graphical Console (KVM-IP) service of this manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if the Graphical Console service is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol used for Graphical Console purposes.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

MaxConcurrentSessions.description: Indicates the maximum number of Graphical Console sessions, regardless of protocol, this manager is able to support.
MaxConcurrentSessions.specification: The value of this property shall contain the maximum number of concurrent Graphical Console sessions supported by the implementation.

ConnectTypesSupported.description: This object is used to enumerate the Graphical Console connection types allowed by the implementation.

enumDescriptions.KVMIP: The controller supports a Graphical Console connection using a KVM-IP (redirection of Keyboard, Video, Mouse over IP) protocol
enumDescriptions.Oem: The controller supports a Graphical Console connection using an OEM-specific protocol

ConnectTypesSupported.specification: The value of ConnectTypes shall be an array of the enumerations provided here.  RDP shall be included if the Remote Desktop (RDP) protocol is supported.  KVMIP shall be included if a vendor-define KVM-IP protocol is supported.

AvailableActions.description: An array listing the available custom actions that can be performed on this Manager.

Action.specification: This defines the name of the custom action supported when used in conjunction with a POST operation to this resource. When issued, this operation will perform a reset of the manager.
Action.description: The reset action resets/reboots the manager.

anyOf.description: This array item defines an available custom action on this resource.

Action.specification: This defines the name of the custom action supported when used in conjunction with a POST operation to this resource. When issued, this operation will perform a forced failover of the manager's redundancy to the manager supplied as a parameter.
Action.description: The ForceFailover action forces a failover of this manager to the manager used in the href below.

PropertyName.specification: This defines the property name for which the following allowable values apply.

AllowableValues.specification: This array defines the supported values for this property on this resource.  In this hase, a valid href is supported.

Capabilities.specification: This array item defines the allowable values supported for this custom action on this resource.

anyOf.description: This array item defines an available custom action on this resource.

Action.specification: This defines the name of the custom action for which the following properties are supported on this resource.  The ModifyRedundancySet operation shall be used to add or remove members to a redundant group of manager.
Action.description: The ModifyRedundancySet operation is used to add or remove members to a redundant group of manager.

PropertyName.specification: This defines the property name for which the following allowable values apply.  Add shall be used to Add members to the manager redundancy group.  Remove shall be used to remove members from the manager redundancy group.

AllowableValues.specification: This array defines the supported values for this property on this resource.

Capabilities.specification: This array item defines the allowable values supported for this custom action on this resource.

anyOf.description: This array item defines an available custom action on this resource.
